subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] for Bruce Halliday - A technician request
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_6a1700d9-eae9-4ca9-b265-3504e94367e1_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Ron,
 
I bought one of these and the reviews from other users are that it =
works fantasticaly to enhance weak signals but does not disturb the stronge=
r signals you may be getting
take a look
 
http://search.ebay.com/SELECT-A-=
TENNA_W0QQ_trksidZm37QQfromZR40QQsatitleZSELECTQ2dAQ2dTENNA
 
The best part=
 is, no batteries and no connection just place it near the radio and adjust=
 the dial.
 
bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: warri=
or18eii@...: Wed, 9 Jan 2008 07:12:14 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 for Bruce Halliday - A technician request






Ron,If and when you get th=
e chance, try this out. It is an active antenna that acts as a 60' longwire=
. I believe Sumption may have posted this before. Ramsey Electronics is a f=
avorite of mine so I cruise their site a lot.http://www.ramseyelectronics.c=
om/cgi-bin/commerce.exe?preadd=3Daction&key=3DAA7CRegards,Frank R.
----- Or=
iginal Message ----From: Ron Lederer <ronriko@...>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups.comSent: Wednesday, January 9, 2008 8:46:19 AMSubject: RE: [EVP-ITC] f=
or Bruce Halliday - A technician request


Thanks for the encouragement Bru=
ce.  You are correct I have a rs 12-469 and I cut the pin so it scans conti=
nually when needed.   I at times used audacity on my computer to record, th=
inking that speed control would be useful to interpret messages...nice thou=
ght.   I like the simplicity of your suggestion to just plug the radio dire=
ctly into the digital recorder.  Not knowing exactly how all this goes down=
, I thought the radio scan sounds need to mix in the room so that the techs=
 on the other side can respond.  Whatever works.  
 
The other main questio=
n I have is regarding the radio stations I can pick up here in my part of M=
exico, on the Yucatan.  I only get several stations during a complete scan =
of all a.m. or f.m. channels...don' t know if that is enough.  It has been =
suggested that I somehow can add an antenna to search for more channels, wh=
ich I would attempt if it is really necessary.  I get mostly Spanish langua=
ge stations and an occasional station from Texas that skips across the Gulf=
 of Mexico.  Not much to scan.  Any thoughts on this?
 
By the way, I think=
 the work you are doing is, well, extraordinary.    Like pros from any othe=
r field of endeavor, you make this stuff look easy to do...not so.  Thanks =
again.   Ron L  
bruce halliday <paranormalinvestiga ting@hotmail. com> wro=
te:


Hey Ron L., In my experience it does not matter what language you rec=
ieve the signal in.The entities are using only fragments, small bits and pi=
eces of the radio signalto form the words. Therefore it does not matter if =
the radio signal is in spanish or english or any other language for that ma=
tter. Our friends on the other side will manipulate the fragments they need=
 to communicate with you in the language you will understand. Ron you menti=
on that you are using an rs 690 that is not one of the hack model numbers m=
aybe you have gotten the wrong radio model. Check the part number it must b=
e a 12-469or a 12-470 and if it is the 470 it would have to be the older mo=
del or it could not be modified. Can you verify that you have modified the =
rs radio and that it is continually scanning withoutstopping on any one par=
ticular station? Also there would be no need for EVP maker or a microphone =
to be used during a session with the RS boxall you would need is the RS box=
 and a digital recorder, if you have the 469 you would need speakers to rec=
ord the session or plug the digital recorder directly into the radio. Pleas=
e check your equipment and how it is operating and let me know so I can hel=
p you further.Don't worry they are just waiting for you to set up the corre=
ct equipment and they will communicate. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups .comFrom: ronriko@yahoo. comDate: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 11:16:51 -0800=
Subject: [EVP-ITC] for Bruce Halliday - A technician request


Bruce, I now=
 have done a few days testing with my rs 690, evp maker, audacity, a mic, a=
nd my handheld digital recorder.  Nada, nothing, zilch.  Maybe because I on=
ly get to scan past 5 to 8 channels on Am or FM so I don't have enough sign=
als to muster a response.  But from what you and others with experience see=
m to be saying, it shouldn't matter because I will get help from someone on=
 the other-side.  Maybe they can't find me in Mexico?  Please let your tech=
s know I am here...should be no problem with immigration papers or money ex=
change.  I really need help.  Ron Lbruce halliday <paranormalinvestiga ting=
@hotmail. com> wrote: 


Ann,That may be, But I find that when I do a sessi=
on mike and lisa both come through but mike seems to be the more dominant o=
ne. I have asked that mike and lisa help in your sessions as well as other =
new researchers and they seem to comply but I think mikeis more like a supe=
rvisor and delegates actions to other techs. I know that if you do not have=
 a perminent tech that whatever techis available at the time you do your se=
ssion will be assigned to assist you. If it is lisa she is very sweet and w=
ill do her best to give you solid communication. I'm glad she can help. Bru=
ce
Bruce Halliday 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .comFrom: lisby@earthlink. netDa=
te: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 11:40:02 -0500Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: A file from Fr=
ank's box #12 pertaining to lisby's technition


I'm getting the thought th=
at Lisa is bouncing around between us. She's very dominant every time I run=
 a session and I've gotten some good stuff from her, which I will shortly b=
e able to post, I hope. About a week ago, I got a really extraordinary sequ=
ence that ran something along the lines of a male saying, "Lisa, can you do=
 it?" followed by a clear female voice saying, "Testing. Beginning. Ground,=
" and then a second female voice saying "Kick." I was floored.Anyway, Lisa =
seems to be the driver of a lot of what is going on right now. Maybe she in=
tends to work with a number of us?Ann
-----Original Message----- From: bruc=
e halliday Sent: Jan 8, 2008 9:22 AM To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com Subject: =
RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: A file from Frank's box #12 pertaining to lisby's technit=
ion 



Frank, I have two techs that I speak with on a daily basis and one =
of themis Lisa. She could possibly be contacting you with the technical inf=
o she tried to give meyesterday. Bruce
Bruce Halliday 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups .comFrom: franks-boxes@ hotmail.comDate: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 06:39:54 +0000=
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: A file from Frank's box #12 pertaining to lisby's te=
chnition


I've been getting Lisa too, but so far not in any segments tranf=
ered to the PC. Even tonight I heard her, but not while I was taping. Frank=
-S--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:>> Hmmmm. That s=
econd bit gave me the creepies, I must say. What are > your thoughts on tha=
t, Bruce? I hear Lisa's name at least a dozen > times each time I run a ses=
sion, so I feel confident that she is > there, so I feel confident that I'm=
 not in the hands of someone I > don't want to be in. Maybe they are still =
auditioning for the role?> > > On Jan 7, 2008, at 9:49 AM, bhali333 wrote:>=
 > > the precedeing file was from a question about Ann's technition on> > 1=
